member.name: P:CrystalDecisions.Web.ReportPartBookmarkNavigationEventArgs.ReportPartBookmark
member.summary: ReportPartBookmark. This is the report part bookmark information attached to the report object that the user clicked. The report part navigation will go to the report object, ObjectName, in the data context, DataContext, in the report specified by ReportUri. If the ReportUri is "", the navigation will jump to a report part within the same report.

member.name: P:CrystalDecisions.Web.ReportPartBookmarkNavigationEventArgs.NavigationResult
member.summary: ReportPartNavigationResult. The page number, section number, and drill-down context to which the Web Forms viewer will jump in the report part navigation.

member.name: T:CrystalDecisions.Web.CrystalReportViewer
member.summary: Provides properties, methods, and events that give control over how the web forms viewer appears and functions.

member.name: T:CrystalDecisions.Web.CrystalReportViewerBase
member.summary: Base class for the CrystalReportViewer class and the CrystalReportPartsViewer class.

member.name: M:CrystalDecisions.Web.CrystalReportViewerBase.ResetReportPartNavigation
member.summary: Resets the report part navigation viewing mode. After a report part navigation, the report source may be different and will be persisted in the viewstate. The new report source will be used for subsequent postback requests regardless of the report source set in the viewer. The ResetReportPartNavigation method will reset this behavior and use the report source set in the viewer.
member.remarks:
The scenarios to consider are:
Initial report source is set in Page_Load. After navigation, the new report source is persisted in the viewstate. On subsequent requests, the new report source is reloaded during LoadViewState. The call to set initial report source in Page_Load is ignored.
Initial report source is set in OnInit. After navigation, the new report source is persisted in the viewstate. On subsequent requests, the new report source is reloaded during LoadViewState. However, the report source is changed to something else in a event handler.

member.name: M:CrystalDecisions.Web.CrystalReportViewerBase.NavigateTo(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Navigates to a specific report object that satisfies the data context for the current report source.

member.summary:
AutoGenerated resource class. Usage:
string s = ViewerSys.GetString(ViewerSys.MyIdenfitier);

member.name: P:CrystalDecisions.Web.ReportAgentBase.ReportSource
member.remarks: Setting ReportSource more than once clears the report state (e.g. ParameterFieldInfo, LogOnInfo, and SelectionFormula). The report state is accumulated from user code, viewer prompting, and user interaction. Some types of report source such as report file string are persisted in the viewstate. Setting ReportSource again after LoadViewState will also clear the report state.

member.name: T:CrystalDecisions.Web.DrillDownEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the ChartDrillDown event and the FieldDrillDown event.

member.name: P:CrystalDecisions.Web.DrillDownEventArgs.ObjectName
member.summary: Gets the name of the object the user has drilled down on. By default, Crystal Reports generates names like "Field3" or "Text5", but you can rename them in the report designer. The name can only use alphanumeric characters and must start with an alphabetical character. No spaces are allowed.

member.name: P:CrystalDecisions.Web.DrillDownEventArgs.DataContext
member.summary: Gets the data sub tree of the report.

member.name: P:CrystalDecisions.Web.DrillDownEventArgs.GroupName
member.summary: Gets the name of the group that the user has drilled down on. For example, "USA".

member.name: P:CrystalDecisions.Web.DrillDownEventArgs.GroupPath
member.summary: Gets the path of the group the user has drilled down on. The path is displayed as a zero based array. For example "1-2" would indicate the second item in the first group and the third item in the second group.

member.name: T:CrystalDecisions.Web.ReportPartsDefinition

member.summary: Gets or sets the data sub tree of the report.

member.name: P:CrystalDecisions.Web.ReportPartsDefinition.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the display title of the report. The CrystalReportPartViewer.IsDisplayTitle must be set to True.

member.name: P:CrystalDecisions.Web.ReportPartsDefinition.ReportPartNodes
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the drill down information. Use this property to add the parent collection of ReportNodes containing the information representing all the levels of drill down.

member.name: M:CrystalDecisions.Web.CrystalImageCleaner.Start(System.Int32,System.Int64,System.Web.HttpApplicationState)
member.summary: Starts a thread to delete images in the viewers' virtual directory.
member.param: The time between each image deletion process, when the thread is inactive.
The time at which the image file has been last modified.
The state of the ASP.NET application.

member.name: M:CrystalDecisions.Web.CrystalImageCleaner.Stop(System.Web.HttpApplicationState)
member.summary: Stops the thread that handles the image deletion process and removes the CrystalImageCleaner instance that exists in the Web application state.
member.param: The state of the ASP.NET application.

member.name: T:CrystalDecisions.Reporting.WebControls.ParameterList
member.summary: A control that prompts the user for parameter information.
member.remarks:
The list of ParameterField to be prompted is specified by the ParameterFieldInfo property. The CurrentValues property will be modified during a postback if the user has changed the value.
The following table lists the actions performed in each of the ASP server control stages.
Stage Action
Initialize Creates and initializes the renderer.
Load view state Restores ParameterFieldInfo from viewstate.
Process postback data Modifies ParameterFieldInfo using postback data.
Load
Send postback change notifications Raises ParameterChanged event.
Handle postback events Raises ParameterSubmit event.
Prerender
Save state Saves ParameterFieldInfo to viewstate.
Render Renders parameter prompt.
Dispose
Unload

member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with the remove button.

member.name: T:CrystalDecisions.Reporting.WebControls.DatabaseLogOnList
member.summary: A control that prompts the user for database logon information.
member.remarks:
The list of TableLogOnInfo to be prompted is specified by the LogOnInfos property. The UserID and Password properties of ConnectionInfo will be modified during a postback if the user has changed the value.
The following table lists the actions performed in each of the ASP server control stages.
Stage Action
Initialize Creates and initializes the renderer.
Load view state Restores LogOnInfos from viewstate.
Process postback data Modifies LogOnInfos using postback data.
Load
Send postback change notifications Raises LogOnChanged event.
Handle postback events Raises LogOnSubmit event.
Prerender
Save state Saves LogOnInfos to viewstate.
Render Renders log on prompt.
Dispose
Unload

member.name: M:CrystalDecisions.Web.CrystalReportSource.ConvertToValue(CrystalDecisions.Shared.ParameterValueKind,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts an object to a value compatible with the parameter value type. If the object is an empty string and convertEmptyStringToNull is true, null is returned. FormatException is thrown if convertEmptyStringToNull is false and the parameter type is not string.

member.summary: Gets the value of the control property. If there is no control with the same ID specified by ControlID, or the control does not have a property specified by PropertyName, the default value will be returned.
